Madame Adjaratou Yacine exerce le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans .Elle a une expérience dans le crédit car a fait parti d’un groupement ou elle était la trésorière et ou elle a bénéficié de plusieurs  prêts qui lui ont permet d’avoir un bon départ dans son activité. Cette dernière qui consiste  à vendre des sacs, des chaussures, des tissus de l’encens etc.…Adjaratou Yacine est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle  épaule son frère   qui est médecin en lui tenant la comptabilité de sa clinique. Ce qui lui fait une autre source de revenu. Elle aimerait diversifier son commerce et augmenter la quantité de ses marchandises.

loans.use: to buy handbags, shoes, fabric and incense.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Victor es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Desde hace aproximadamente 2 años, Victor inició su negocio de tienda general en la cual vende productos de la canasta familiar, con el ánimo de generar los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Victor tiene este negocio como su fuente de ingresos para poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a sus buenos productos y al buen servicio que ofrece, Victor tiene una gran clientela que le permite tener un muy buen nivel de ventas.

Con el ánimo de generar mayores ingresos y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos, Victor quiere aumentar el surtido de productos de su tiene, sin embargo, no cuenta con un capital suficiente para poder comprar los productos a sus proveedores, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su tienda y ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.

Victor espera con este préstamo poder aumentar sus ventas ya que ofrecerá más productos a sus clientes. Además, sueña con que su negocio crezca y pueda montar un supermercado, del cual sus hijos puedan gozar de una estabilidad económica. Espera poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y mayores posibilidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Victor is a very hard-working person who is devoted to his family.  Approximately two years ago Victor started his business, a general store selling staples.  He did this in order to generate enough income to support his household, where he lives with his wife and four children.  This business is Victor’s source of income so that he is able to give his family a better quality of life. Thanks to his good products and the good service that he offers Victor has a large clientele, which allows him to have a very good level of sales.

With the thought of generating more income and being able to offer his customers a greater variety of products, Victor wants to increase the stock of products that he has.  However, he does not have enough capital to be able to buy the products from his providers.  He therefore has the hope that a loan will give him the opportunity to buy food staples in order to stock his store and offer his customers a greater variety.

Victor hopes that with the loan he will be able to increase his sales because he will be offering his customers more products.  Also, he dreams of his business growing and being able to set up a supermarket so that his children can enjoy financial stability.  He hopes to be able to give his family a better quality of life and greater possibilities for progress.

loans.use: to buy food staples in order to stock his store and offer his customers a greater variety.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa se dedica a la venta de dulces, masitas y refrescos en el kiosco de un colegio en el cual trabaja como portera.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar más dulces para surtir su kiosco para aumentar sus ingresos diarios, pues es el producto que más vende.
Rosa es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive como conserje del colegio donde trabaja ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Rosa sells sweets, pastries, and soft drinks at a kiosk at a school where she works as a janitor.

She needs the loan to buy more sweets to stock her kiosk in order to increase her daily income.  This is the product that sells the most.

Rosa is single and does not have children.  She works as a school janitor in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of sweets to stock the kiosk where she sells at a school in the city of La Paz.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es empleada en una tienda de ropa y también se dedica a la venta de pantalones y artículos para mujer por las noches en un puesto en la calle. El crédito lo requiere para comprar más mercadería de diferente tipo y tener mas ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
  Daniela es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres en la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA. Su historial de créditos muestra que Daniela paga dentro de los límites establecidos en su plan de pagos.
texts.en:
Daniela works in a clothing store, and she also sells pants and women’s items in the evenings at a stand on the street.  She needs the loan to buy more merchandise of different types.  She needs to have more income in order to help her family.

Daniela is single and does not have children.  She lives with her parents in the Alto Sopochachi area of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time she has worked with Kiva.  Her loan history shows the Daniela makes her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more pants and items for women to sell at a stand she has on one of the streets of La Paz.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia trabaja en su profesión de abogada independiente, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Sopocachi ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo necesita para pagar las pensiones del colegio para los estudios de sus hijos, pues la época de clases ya comienza en Febrero.

Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Patricia works as an independent lawyer.  She is a single mother, and she lives with her two children in her parents’ house in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

She needs the loan to pay school tuition for her children as classes start in February.

This is the third time she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay school tuition for her children.

loans.name: Seriousness Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata is 45 years old, married to a businessman, and has seven children, four of whom attend school.  She was born in Malal Rochen village. 

For 15 years, Aminata has been selling used clothes. Aminata will use her share of the loan (600,000 SSL) to buy a bale of used clothes. With the help of this loan, Aminata and her teammates will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Ingrit Frene

texts.es: Ingrit es socia del Banco Comunal los Claveles, tiene 25 años, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 1 año, esta soltera, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y cerveza al por mayor, fue invitada por una socia, agradece porque le va bien en su negocio y en lo personal, también le gusta las capacitaciones, dice que le ayuda a mejorar como persona, gracias a los préstamos no le falta mercadería arroz, leche, aceite y otros, por que puede surtir su tienda, solicita un préstamo para comprar mas cosas, también quiere comprar mas cerveza por que vio que le da mas ganancia, también esta pensando en hacer recargas para celulares.
texts.en: Ingrit is a member of 'Los Claveles' (Carnations) community bank.  She is 25 years old and has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  Her business is selling groceries and beer wholesale.  She was invited to join FINCA by an existing member.  She is grateful because she is doing well in her business and also in her personal life.  She enjoys the training sessions.  She says that they help her to improve as a person.  Thanks to her loans, she does not lack merchandise (rice, milk, oil, etc.) with which to stock her store.  She is requesting this loan to buy more products.  She would also like to buy more beer because she has seen that it makes her more profits.  She is thinking of starting to sell cell phone minutes.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store business

loans.name: Siviai

texts.es:
La señora siviai cuenta con 25 años de edad y está casada con el señor Cristino quien es albañil, tienen 1 hijo Eliel de 7 años de edad y cursa el segundo año de primaria, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con el cual lleva 10 años.
Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad porque quería independizarse un poco mas y ganar su propio dinero, también para apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios y contar con una mejor solvencia económica y calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: leche, aceite, arroz, jabón, galletas, refrescos etc. Para tener mejor surtido.
Doña sivia tiene un gran sueño es el de construir un local para poner su tienda de abarrotes, ya que así podrá tener muy bien surtido y contar con una amplia variedad de productos, puesto que así mejorara e incrementara sus ganancias, para asegurar el futuro de su hijo y pueda tener una muy buena carrera profesional.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad por el gran apoyo que les están aportando, ya que con esta ayuda ha mejorado su negocio y la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sivia is 25 years old.  She is married to Cristino, who is a builder.  They have one son, Eliel, who is 7 years old and in the second year of elementary school.  Sivia has a grocery store which she has been running for 10 years.  She says that she decided to invest in this business because she wanted to become a little more independent and earn her own money.  She also wanted to support her son in his studies and enjoy better financial solvency and a better quality of life.  She will invest the loan that she received in buying more merchandise such as milk, oil, rice, soap, cookies, soft drinks, etc. so that she can have a better stocked business.

Sivia's big dream is to build premises for her grocery store as this would enable her to have a very well stocked store and offer a wide range of products.  This would allow her to improve and increase her profits so that she can guarantee her son's future and ensure he has a very good career.

Sivia thanks Fundación Realidad for the support that they are giving her as it has enabled her to improve her business and her family's life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as milk, oil, rice, soap, cookies, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад добрый и трудолюбивый семьянин. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 17 лет он занимается перевозкой грузов. Имеет два грузовых автомобиля, один сдал в аренду. Он очень любит свой бизнес и с удовольствием занимается этим.  Он является единственным кормильцем в своей семье. Абдусамад запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки нового грузового автомобиля, чтобы сдать в аренду. От этого он получает дополнительный доход. Абдусамад надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Abdusamad is a kind and hard-working family man. His wife takes care of the household. For over 17 years, Abdusamad has been transporting cargo and has two lorries; one of them he's been leasing to someone else. He loves his business very much and has fun doing it. He is the only breadwinner in his family. Abdusamad is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni in order to purchase another lorry to lease out. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy a lorry

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Саёхат более 5 лет занимается купле- продажей разных одежд и вещей. Она замужем и любящая мать одного ребенка. Муж припадает в школе, он учитель. Она очень трудолюбивая и старательная женщина. Саёхат приобретает товары из рынка города, а затем продает в разных кишлаках города. В бизнесе помогает мать. Саёхат запрашивает займ в размере 3000 Сомони для новой ассортимент одежды с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Sayohat has been involved in buying and selling various items of clothing and other goods for more than 5 years.  She is married and the loving mother of one child.  Her husband, who is a teacher, teaches in a school.  Sayohat is a very hardworking and industrious woman.  She purchases her goods at the market in town and resells in different kishlaks, or settlements, in town.  Her mother helps her with the business.  She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy new assortment of clothing in order to expand her business

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris, 42 years old, is married and has two children. She has operated a bakery for 4 years and sells clothes to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Peris has been able to grow her business, which she hopes to expand in the future. Peris has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy a cake mixer.

loans.use: To buy a cake mixer

loans.name: Tuzamurane/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean de Dieu fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane. Il a 46 ans et il est marié, avec 6 enfants de 1 à 12 ans  dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 8 ans de primaire.

Jean de Dieu est commerçante. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter de sucre, des savons, ognons, etc…

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’accroitre l’activité actuelle de son commerce et améliore les services de qualité dans son commerce. Dans les prochaines années, Jean de Dieu voudrait être le  grand commerçant. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is a member of the Tuzamurane group. He is 46 years old and married with six children aged 1 to 12, three of whom are in school. He attended primary school up to the 8th grade.

Jean de Dieu is a merchant. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use the loan to buy sugar, soap, onions, etc.

His business growth strategy is to increase his level of activity and improve the quality of his services. In the coming years, Jean de Dieu would like to become an important businessman. He will use his profits to provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, onions, etc.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, trabaja independientemente como consultor legal, realiza tramites legales y otros.
El crédito lo necesita para implementar su oficina (compra de escritorio, sillas y anaqueles (shelf en inglés)) y brindar mejor atención  a sus clientes para de esta forma obtener mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Carlos, es casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos, su esposa trabaja como diseñadora de modas y viven en la zona de Achumani ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Carlos works independently as a legal consultant doing legal procedures and others.

He needs the loan to outfit his office (to buy a desk, chairs, and shelves).  He will then provide his customers with better attention and get greater income to help his family.

Carlos is married, and he lives with his wife and their children.  His wife works as a fashion designer.  They live in the Achumani area in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO, and the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a desk, chairs, and shelves for his legal consultation office.

loans.name: Crisostomo

texts.es:
El señor Crisóstomo trabaja en el área de la construcción como albañil y presta sus servicios para todo tipo de obras dentro de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para  comprar  material de construcción (ladrillo, cemento, estuco, arena) para la refacción de una habitación en su casa y dar más comodidad a su familia.
Crisóstomo, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en casa propia en la zona de Bella vista ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la cuarta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO Y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Crisóstomo works in construction as a bricklayer.  He offers his services for all types of work in the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, stucco, sand) to repair a room in his house and to make his family more comfortable.

Crisóstomo is married and has four children.  He lives in his own house in the Bella district in the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, stucco, and sand to repair a room in his house and to make his children more comfortable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To move into a bigger and more permanent structure where she will be able to work longer hours and serve more customers.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian es estudiante y trabaja como guía de turismo. El crédito lo requiere para pagar sus estudios de la Universidad en la carrera de Turismoy tener una profesión para ayudar a su familia.
Christian vive con sus padres en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Christian is a student, and he works as a tour guide.  

He needs the loan to pay for his university studies for a career in tourism.  He will then have a profession in order to help his family.

Christian lives with his parents in the Sopocachi district of the city of La Paz.  He is single, and he does not have children.

This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for tuition at the university in order to continue studying for a career in tourism.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 25 years old and runs her own mobile money transfer business in the busy town of Kitwe, Zambia. She currently has three young women working for her as tellers to help her serve her many customers. 

Sandra first started off as an employee of Mobile Transactions. Though she never saw herself as an entrepreneur, when the opportunity came up to start her own business she rose to the occasion and since then she has never looked back. 

From the time she started running her business two years ago, she has managed to grow her working capital from only $600 to over $4000. She has created a large market for herself which she now cannot satisfy even with her larger than average working capital. 

Sandra wants a loan from Kiva lenders to increase her working capital so that she can always be able to serve her customers instead of having to turn them away. 

Sandra believes that once the loan comes in, she will be able to satisfy all of her customers' needs to send larger amounts of money, thereby enabling her to make more profit. According to her, this will not only improve her standard of living but will allow her to give a raise to each of her three hard-working employees.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so that she can always be able to serve her customers instead of having to turn them away.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es jubilada y  recibe su renta cada mes para mantener a su 
Familia.

El crédito lo necesita para pagar la matricula de la Universidad de su hija para que pueda continuar con sus estudios y después ser un apoyo para ella.

Maria, es viuda y vive con sus dos hijas en una casa en anticretico en la zona de Sopocachi ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria is retired, and she receives her pension every month in order to support her family.

She needs the loan to pay for the university fees for her daughter so that her daughter will be able to continue her education.  Later, her daughter will be a support for her.

Maria, a widow, lives with her two daughters in an “anticreditco” house (a special rental arrangement in Bolivia where a tenant pays a fixed sum upon renting a house instead of monthly rent; the sum is considered a loan to the property owner and is returned in full when the rental period is over.)  They live in the Sopocachi district in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay university fees so that her daughter may continue studying and become a professional.

loans.name: Abanyakuri Group

texts.fr:
Jeannette fait partie du groupe Abanyakuri. Elle a 34 ans et elle est mariée, avec 5 enfants de 5 à 18 ans ils ont tous scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de secondaire.

Jeannette est commerçante. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des  10 sacs de sucre, du farine et 14 paire des pagnes.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’accroitre l’activité actuelle du commerce et travail beaucoup pour satisfaire les clients, améliore les services de qualité dans son commerce. Dans les prochaines années, Jeannette voudrait être la  grande commerçante. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants et acheter sa maison propre.
texts.en:
Jeannette is a member of the Abanyakuri group. She is 34 years old and married with five children aged 5 to 18, all in school. Jeannette herself attended 5 years of high school.

Jeannette is a merchant. This is her second loan cycle with ACB, and she will use the funds to buy 10 bags of sugar, some flour and 14 sets of pagnes (colorful West-African cloth).  

Her business growth strategy is to bolster her level of activity, work hard to meet customer demand, and improve the quality of her services. In the coming years, she would like to become an important businesswoman. She plans to use her profits to provide for her children’s education and to buy a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of sugar, some flour and 14 sets of pagnes.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly is a 24-year-old woman who lives in Solwezi. She was born into a family of five in which she is the last born. She is a model young entrepreneur who runs her own mobile money transfer business. After getting her college diploma in Business Administration, she opted not to look for employment but rather started her own business in which she has managed to employ one person and hopes to employ more. 

For Lilly there is more to owning and running a business than just transacting money. She believes that social entrepreneurship is the best way to go and her kind of business is ideal because it is located where the people are and the atmosphere it creates is welcoming rather than the cold, detached feeling of a bank. Lilly also believes that her business has the added advantage of being cheaper, faster and easier to access than the post office or commercial banks. 

When she gets the loan money Lilly intends to fix her booth which she currently uses to serve her customers. Her booth is not in  good condition, it leaks when the rains come and has no proper shelter for her customers. She would like to get a new booth and needs help to do this; it will also help her to expand her business which is her goal as a young businesswoman. 

In this video, Lilly is being interviewed by a representative from Mobile Transactions.

loans.use: To fix her booth which she currently uses to serve her customers.

loans.name: Marysol

texts.es:
Marysol trabaja realizando consultorías en una empresa en la ciudad de La 
Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad con el cual trabaja su esposo como chofer propietario para mantener a su familia.

Ella es casada y no tiene hijos, viven en una casa alquilada  en la zona Buenos Aires de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la segunda con KIVA.
texts.en:
Marysol does consulting work for a company in the city of La Paz.

She needs the loan for maintenance on her husband’s vehicle, which he uses to work as a driver.  He does this to support his family.

She is married, and she does not have children.  She lives in a rented house in the Buenos Aires area of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time she has worked with IMRO, and it is the second time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena cuenta con 49 años de edad y está casada con el señor Amadeo quien es campesino, tienen 2 hijos, Abraham y lucio quienes cursan primer año de prepa y segundo año de secundaria, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos desde hace mas de 5 años.
Dice que inicio con esta actividad ya que quería poyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos, también para mejorar un poco su nivel de vida y contar con una solvencia económica más estable, y así poder vivir cómodamente, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas insumos como son: aceite, sal, frijol, arroz, carnes, pollos, quesos, jitomates, chiles, cebollas, etc. 
El anhelo más grande que tiene doña Elena es el de poder hacer crecer aun mas su negocio y ampliarlo, para así tener una mejor producción y surtido para incrementar un poco mas sus ganancias. 
Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatarios de kiva, por toda la ayuda y la confianza que le están ofreciendo, ya que gracias al apoyo recibido su vida ha cambiado mucho al igual que su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena is 49 years old and married to Sr. Amadeo with whom she has two children, Abraham and Lucio who attend high school. They live in the countryside. Elena has earned her living making and selling antojitos (traditional corn-based dishes) for more than five years.

She started the business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and the cost of educating their children. As well she wanted to improve the family’s standard of living and have a more stable income so they could live more comfortably. 

The loan that Elena has received will be used to buy ingredients such as oil, salt, beans, rice, meat, chicken, cheese, jitomates, chiles, onions etc. Her greatest wish is to grow her business even more so that she makes and sells more antojitos and increases her earnings a little.

Elena is very grateful to the Realidad Foundation and to Kiva’s donors for all the assistance and the trust they have placed in her. Thanks to this help her life and business have changed greatly.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as oil, salt, beans, rice, meat, chicken, cheese, jitomates, chiles, onions

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали житель пригорного района, что видно на его фото. Он с молодости занимается откормом и продажей скота. Покупает скот на Чайрухском рынке скота. За три года кредитования c Арванд он смог увеличить свой товарооборот , численность мелкорогатого скота. Ему помогает его жена, она доит одну дойную корову, которая даёт в день 5 литров молока. Он выражает большую благодарность организации и инвесторам за финансовую поддержку, благодаря которой Сафарали смог улучшить социальное положение семьи. Получаемый кредит он планирует потратить на приобретение молодых баранов и коз, несколько десятков.
texts.en: Safarali lives near mountains, as can be seen in his photo. Since his youth, he's been fattening and selling cattle, which he buys at the Chairukh animal market. During the three years he has been receiving loans from Arvand, he has been able to increase his turnover and the number of smaller animals in his herd. Safarali is helped by his wife, who milks a cow that gives 5 litres of mild per day. He would like to express his gratitude to his creditors for the financial aid, thanks to which he has been able to improve the social standing of his family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
For the last 3 years, Tom has been practicing farming in Oloitoktok town. He is 34 years old, married to Elizabeth. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to buy a stock of cereals for his cereal shop that he operates alongside farming.

In the future, Tom hopes to practice large-scale farming, which will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cereals for his cereal shop

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 45-year-old lady from Kisumu City in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Mathew and they have 5 children. 

Janet operates a food stall selling French fries (chips) and has been doing this business for the last 12 years. She makes a monthly profit of 11,000 KES. She is taking her first loan with KADET LTD which she will use to buy cooking oil and potatoes. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her desire is to grow her business and to provide fully to her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and potatoes.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es una mujer muy hacendosa, tiene 42 años. Vive con su esposo Rómulo de 42 años y sus 04 hijos, por el momento habitan en su chacra donde tienen una casa de madera hasta terminar la construcción de su vivienda a base de  material noble. Desde hace 30  años, por principios de la vida, ella empezó a dedicarse a la siembra de plantas de café; a inicios tuvo que esforzarse trabajando para otros en los campos de cultivo y gracias a sus ahorros hoy tiene su propia terreno con cultivos de café; que ahora con mucho esmero se dedica. Con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos llegan  a obtener buenos resultados de cosecha gracias al optimismo que tienen, con la finalidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.  Con las colectas de sus frutos que las lleva a vender a los centros de acopio donde le pagan a buenos precios; llegaron a invertir en la compra de  su terreno para construir su casa, asimismo realizando el mantenimiento de sus plantas. Lo que más anhela es poder terminar la construcción de su hogar.  Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP y será muy responsable como siempre, además está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque son personas responsables. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará materiales de construcción como: fierros, cemento, ect.
texts.en:
42-year old Ana is a hardworking woman who lives with her 42-year old husband Rómulo and their four children. They currently live on their farm where they have a house made of wood while they finish building their new home made of better-quality materials. 

For more than 30 years, since the beginning of her working life, Ana has earned her living growing coffee. At the start she had to work for other people and then, with her savings, she bought land and today has her own coffee fields which she tends carefully. 

With help from her husband and children and a certain amount of optimism she gets good harvests. Her goal is to improve the family’s standard of living. She takes the coffee to sell at central warehouses where they pay good prices. They have managed to buy land on which to build their house and also to look after the coffee plants. Now Ana’s greatest wish is to be able to finish the new house. This will be her fourth loan with MFP; she will be as responsible as always with the repayments. She is happy with the work of her community bank as it is made up of responsible people. With the S/. 1,000 loan she will buy construction material such as metal supports and cement.

loans.use: to buy construction material such as metal supports and cement for her new house

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 27 years old, married, and has one child. To earn a living, he sells phone chargers and batteries, which he has been doing for seven years. He employs four people. 

George is requesting a loan for 80,000 KES, which he will use to buy phone chargers and batteries. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase phone chargers and batteries.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a 34 year old man who runs a retail and a nursery school which he has operated for 10 years.  He is married with 4 children of school going age.

He started the retail shop with the money he got from farming and from this business he has managed to start a nursery school.  He faces a problem of of price fluctuations and inadequate capital to provide teachers with the necessary equipment.  Frank dreams of having his children educated, building a good house and starting a primary school.  Frank wants a loan to buy textbooks for the nursery school.

loans.use: To buy textbooks for the nursery school.

loans.name: Asienzo

texts.en:
Asienzo is a 38-year-old business woman who lives in Juba Nimule. She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 10 and 22 years; all of them go to school. 

Asienzo runs a food store business. She has been in the business for 2 years. She has no employees. Asienzo heard about Finance Sudan from fellow clients, outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 500 SDG to purchase more items like beans, sesame, and many others. Asienzo has no other source of income but this business. 

In 5 years time, Asienzo would like to hope for improvement of her business and at least build a house. Her major challenges include home expenses and school fees. 

Asienzo says that she is happy for Finance South Sudan’s support. She gives them a lot of thanks for the financial support given.

loans.use: to purchase more items like beans, sesame, and many others

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is going on with his business. Now in business he has only one helper: his one son, as the next of his twin sons is now working as a bodyguard.

Because of cold weather in Armenia during January and February 2012, Vladimir has great demand for high boots. But he can’t manage to produce high boots in large quantities during a short time, so he orders shoes from different shoemakers. Vladimir’s first Kiva loan allowed him to buy shoes and materials for his business. Now he needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy necessary materials: soles, leather, chamois leather, etc. for his shoe production. This fact will allow him to satisfy needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials: soles, leather, chamois leather, etc. for his shoe production

loans.name: Relationship Group

texts.en:
Adama is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Adama was born in Lunsar town, about 37 years ago. She is married and the couple has 3 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Adama sells cooked rice, biscuits, soft drinks, sardines, luncheon meats, sugar, palm-oil, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Adama and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Adama will use her share of the loan (SLL 600,000) to buy cooking ingredients like uncooked rice, palm-oil, etc. in large quantity in order to be able to produce a large quantity of cooked rice for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like uncooked rice, palm-oil, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Isack

texts.en:
Isack is a 32 year old man from Kisumu City, who is married to Monica and they have three children aged two, four, and six years old.

Isack is a cobbler and also a shoe shiner, a business he has done for the last 12 years, making a monthly income of KES 15,000.  He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy shoe laces, inner soles and shoe soles.  He will use the anticipated profit to grow his business and venture into other businesses.

His dream is to open a shoe factory and make new shoes and also to provide for his family fully.

loans.use: To buy shoe laces, inner shoe soles and shoe soles.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
For the last one year Salome has been practicing poultry farming in Oloitoktok town.  She is 30 years old and a single mother of five children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client.  This will be her first loan.  She intends to use the loan amount to purchase more chicks for rearing, which she will later sell at a profit. 

In the future, Salome hopes to practice large scale poultry farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks for rearing, which she will later sell at a profit.

loans.name: Geresomu

texts.en:
Geresomu is a 22 year old hardworking man.  He runs a local brew business which he has operated for 2 years now.  He got the start up capital from his father and the business has improved steadly, from which he has been able to start building a commercial house.

He faces a hardship of inadequate capital and the high competition around him.  Geresomu hopes, if provided with a loan, he will be able to grow his business to other levels like exporting to outside countries.  Therefore, he wants a loan to complete his commercial building so as to operate in his own place instead of renting.

loans.use: To complete building his commercial house.

loans.name: Marisella

texts.en:
Marisella is a 25 year old married woman with two children, all of them are in school.  She has had a business selling fish in Yambio, South Sudan for the past four years.

Marisella is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Zonia Elisabeth

texts.es:
Zonia Elisabeth, tiene 50 años de edad, casada desde hace 12 años, su esposo vive en Estados Unidos, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad de 30, 28 y 26 años quienes ya se han independizado, vive en la Colonia López Arellano de Choloma.

Doña Zonia, hace un año que se dedica a vender mercadería en general como ropa, calzado, cosméticos de productos AVON, y  adicionalmente vende golosinas. Anteriormente tenía un negocio de pulpería y venta de productos nutricionales, y de las ganancias que obtuvo comenzó este negocio. Atiende clientes de lunes a domingo.
Ella ha solicitado cinco préstamos a ODEF y actualmente  solicita L. 3,000.00 para comprar mercadería que le han pedido los clientes y va reparar una parte del techo de la casa.
Su  motivación es crecer como comerciante y tener mejor su vivienda.
texts.en:
Zonia Elisabeth is 50 years old and has been married for 12 years. Her husband lives in the United States. She has three grown children (ages 30, 28, and 26) who are already independent. Zonia lives in the subdivision of López Arrelano in Choloma.

For the past year, Doña Zonia has been selling general merchandise such as clothing, shoes, Avon cosmetics, and other products such as candy. She previously owned a grocery store and sold nutritional products. Zonia used her earnings to start this business. She attends to her customers from Monday to Sunday. Zonia has requested five loans from ODEF and is currently asking for 3,000 HNL in order to buy merchandise her customers request and to repair part of the roof of her house.

Her motivation is to grow as a businesswoman and to have a better home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to pay for roof repairs.

loans.name: Argentina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ceprodel se ha caracterizado por apoyar financieramente a los maestros de las comunidades para que se desarrollen en su actividad económica y nivel de vida. En el municipio de Telica en León, la señora Argentina, es maestra de primaria con 18 años de ejercer tan noble labor. Es Madre Soltera y con 2 hijos procreados bajo su cargo, a los cuales tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones para su desarrollo.

La necesidad inmediata que presenta es la compra de materiales de construcción como: Bloques, Cemento, Zinc, arena y Alfajillas. por eso ella se presentó a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento para y de esa manera lograr concretizar su sueño de mejorar su vivienda y tener mejores condiciones y nivel de vida con sus hijos.
texts.en:
CEPRODEL is known for providing economic support to teachers in the community so that they can develop their finances and their standard of living.

In the municipality of Telica in León, Sra. Argentina works as an elementary school teacher and has been in this noble profession for 18 years. She is a single mother with two children under her care, so she must provide the conditions necessary for their development.

Argentina has an immediate need to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, zinc, sand, and lumber. For this reason, she came to CEPRODEL to receive the benefits of a loan so that she can fulfill her dream of improving her home and providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Aidé

texts.es: Aidé es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles, tiene 39 años, es madre de 4 hijos, 2 están en la universidad y los otros dos son menores, es socia de FINCA Perú hace mas de 14 años, es casada, se dedica a la venta abarrotes, útiles y gas. Gracias a los préstamos que recibe se esta superando, la capacitaciones le han ayudado a solucionar sus problemas, como por ejemplo el accidente que tuvo su esposo, lo pudo superar y esta saliendo adelante, ahora su hijo mayor ingresó a la escuela de Sub Oficiales, dice que si no fuera por los préstamos que le dan y si no hubiera ahorrado, no hubiera logrado sacar profesional a su hijo y mantener a su familia cuando su esposo estaba mal. Estando en Finca Perú logró hacer su casa el cual ahora quiere alquilar para eventos,  el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mochilas y útiles escolares, ya que se viene la campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Aidé is a member of the Communal Bank Los Claveles. She is 39 years old. She is a mother to 4 children, 2 of whom are in university and the others are minors. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for more than 14 years. She is married. She sells groceries, school supplies and gas for a living. Thanks to the loans that she has received she has improved herself. The training has helped her to solve her problems, for example the accident that her husband had - she helped him to get better and he is now coming out on top. Now her eldest son has entered the NCO school. 

She says that if it weren't for the loans that she received, and if she had not saved up, her son would not have had the opportunity to become a professional and she would not have been able to support her family when her husband was unwell. Being a part of Finca Perú has helped her to make her house into a place that she would like to rent out for events. The loan that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of backpacks and school supplies, since it is back to school time again.

loans.use: to buy backpacks and school supplies.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is 37 years old, married, and has four children. He sells car tires to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a 70,000 KES loan to buy car tires to resell.

loans.use: To buy car tires

loans.name: Patu

texts.en: Patu is a 38-year-old married man with eight children. For the past eight years, he has operated a retail shop. He started the business with money he got from farming, which was his original business. He faces problems of price fluctuation and inflation, which hinder the profits he is able to make. His primary wish is to have his children educated and to see his business expand. Patu wants a loan to buy salt, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, soap for his shop

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa est un homme marié de 35 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Dialanikoro de Bougouni. 
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 5 eme année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), très vite il s’initia aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment  à l’achat vente de chaussures apprise auprès de son père. Avec une expérience de plus de 5 ans; il maitrise cette activité et a une grande notoriété.
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, il est à son  deuxième prêt, qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 10 douzaines de chaussures pour homme et femme de différentes qualités.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès de grossistes. Ses articles sont vendus au grand marché de Bougouni et dans les villages environnants les jours de foires hebdomadaires, à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Il  espère réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 65.000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les entreprises.
texts.en:
Mister Drissa is a 35 year old married man and father to two children. He lives with his wife and his children in the Dialanikoro district of Bougouni.

Having left school in the 5th year fundamental class (Malian educational system), very quickly he was initiated into income generating businesses, notably into buying and selling shoes which he learned from his father. With more than 5 years experience, he masters this business and is generally known.

After having correctly repaid the first loan, he is on his second loan, which he plans to use to buy 10 dozen shoes of different types for men and women.

He gets his supplies in Bamako at the wholesalers. His items are sold in the large market of Bougouni and in the surrounding villages on the days of weekly fairs, to a diverse and varied clientèle.

With this loan he hopes to make a monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan, meet the family expenses and reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, quiere continuar en la producción y comercialización de hortalizas, ya que de esta actividad depende su familia, se dispone a iniciar la siembra de chiles, tomates, para esto necesita la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, semilla, con estos materiales espera realizar una mejor labor y obtener una buena cosecha. 
Él considera que estos préstamos le ayudan para mejorar su producción con la compra de los insumos necesarios.
texts.en:
Luis wants to continue producing and selling vegetables, as his family depends on this livelihood. He is ready to start planting chiles, tomatoes, and for this he needs to buy fertilizers, fungicides, and seed. 

With these materials he hopes to work more productively and get a good harvest. He considers that these loans help him to improve his production, through the purchase of the necessary agricultural supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, fungicides, and seed.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, se ha decidido a solicitar nuevamente un préstamo, para poder comprase maíz  y leña, para elaborar tortillas, además de comprar algunos ingredientes para hacer antojitos, ella considera que esta ayuda que se le brinda le permite mejorar poco a poco con las ganancias, manteniendo una ocupación y cubriendo los gastos familiares.
El prestamo anterior le ayudo para comprarse y mantener lo necesario en maiz y leña.
texts.en: Maritza has decided to apply for a new loan to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas; she will also buy some ingredients to make fast food.  She believes that this help she’s getting will make it possible for her to improve her profits little by little staying employed and covering family expenses.  Her previous loan helped her buy and store the necessary corn and firewood.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
Melida, solicita un nuevo préstamo ya que considera que son de mucha ayuda para mejorar el negocio, comprando cualquier producto o materiales para el negocio, en esta oportunidad comprara otra cocina y materiales para hacer hot dog, como salchichas, aderezos, aceite, pan.
Ella comenta que su experiencia con el crédito anterior fue muy provechosa, porque le aporto unas ganancias para cubrir algunas necesidades familiares, ella espera que esta nueva deuda tambien le ayude a mejorar.
texts.en: Melida asks for a new loan because she believes that they are of much help for her to improve her business buying whatever product or supplies for the business.  On this occasion she will buy a new stove and supplies to make hotdogs like sausages, condiments, oil and bread.  She comments that her experience with her previous loan was very profitable because she earned profits to cover some family needs.  She hopes this new debt will also help her to improve.

loans.use: to buy another stove, sausages, contiments, oil and bread.

loans.name: Foni,

texts.en:
Foni is a 25-year-old business woman who lives in Juba Nimule. She is married and has three children between the ages of 7 and 1. Two of her children go to school. 

Foni runs a food store; she has been in the business for two years. She has no employees. Foni heard about Finance Sudan from friends and clients, through outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 600 SDG to purchase more items like beans, rice, sugar, sesame, etc. Foni has no other source of income. 

In five years, Foni would like to have a better food store in the market. Her major challenges include home expenses and low income rate. Foni says that she is appreciating Finance Sudan’s support in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more items like beans, rice, sugar, sesame, etc.

loans.name: Minisare

texts.en:
Minisare is a 23-year-old single woman with no children. She has had a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for two years.
Minisare is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has been selling scrap metal for the past 11 years in Oloitoktok. She is a 51-year-old widow and mother of nine children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to increase her stock of scrap metal.

In the future, Susan hopes to expand her business and venture into farming.

loans.use: to add to stock of scrap metal.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a male of 36 years with six children. For the past 20 years, he has run a business dealing in local brew. He started this business with money he made from farming and now is steadily growing his business. The high prices of raw materials and price fluctuations hinder his business. He would like to diversify his business into other sectors. Joseph wants a loan to buy local brew for sale.

loans.use: to buy local brew for sale.

loans.name: Sprosa

texts.en:
Sprosa has been practicing farming for the last nine years in Oloitoktok. She is 72 years old and married to Ndege. They have seven children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to boost her fish-selling kiosk that she runs alongside farming.
 
In the future, Siprosa hopes to practice large-scale farming and also expand her fish-selling business.

loans.use: to boost her fish-selling kiosk.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 30 years old with four children and a wife. He has a motorcycle transport business, known as "boda boda," which he has operated for one year. He started with a retail shop and then bought a motorcycle. The business has been very lucrative. High fuel costs are a challenge in his business. He dreams of building a permanent house and buying a car. Richard wants a loan to buy another motorcycle for his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana se dedica al comercio de ropa, su mercadería lo vende en las ferias de Cochabamba y la localidad de Quillacollo, la venta es de forma ambulante, solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa de temporada ya que por las fechas de fin de año tiene que contar con mercadería mas surtida,  vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus suegros en compañía de su esposo y su hijo, se dedica a esta actividad hace dos años desde que tuvo su hijo. Valora en gran medida que emprender le abra las puertas ya que en otras instituciones no le brindaron la ayuda que ella esperaba.
texts.en: Juana has a business selling clothes. She sells her merchandise in Cochabamba and the locality of Quillacollo street markets. She works as a street vendor. She is requesting the loan to buy season clothes, as she needs to have more varied merchandise at this time of the year. She lives in her parents-in-law’s house with her husband and son. She has been doing this work for two years, since her son was born. She greatly values the way in which Emprender has opened its doors for her, as other institutions did not provide her with the aid she was hoping for.

loans.use: to have the necessary capital to buy season clothes.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa, a 36-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school, has been operating a business selling charcoal in Yambio South Sudan for two years. Rosa is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal, and will use the extra income arising from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 46-year-old married man living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a produce store that he started ten years ago. He started buying and selling coffee, which is how he managed to raise money to start a produce store. In spite of his progress, he faces a challenge of price fluctuation, inflation, and seasonal customers. Jackson's dream is to educate his children and diversify his business. Jackson needs the loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Henry Aldrin

texts.es:
El Señor Henry  tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa desde hace 5 años, tiene 3 hijos (12, 10 y 4 años), reside en la zona urbana del municipio de San Pedro Sula.
Don Henry  trabajaba en un taller como ayudante de ebanistería, hace 9 años decidió establecer su propio negocio con el propósito de buscar la independencia económica. En su taller de ebanistería él  fabrica: closet, puertas, ventanas, divisiones, gaveteros, armarios, muebles de cocina y cualquier objeto de madera.
El ha solicitado un préstamo de 10,000 Lempiras, los cuales invertirá en la compra de materia prima  como ser: madera, barniz, bisagras, adornos, los cuales necesitaba para finalizar un contrato de fabricación de puertas.
Don Henry está agradecido con la institución por el apoyo financiero otorgado, ya que de esta manera el no atrasa sus actividades de fabricación muebles en su taller y obtiene los ingresos necesario para sustentar su familia.
texts.en:
Henry, 36, has lived in a common law relationship with his wife for five years; he has three children (12, 10 and 4 years old) and lives in an urban zone in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.

Henry used to work as an assistant in a woodworking shop and nine years ago decided to set up his own business hoping to attain economic independence.  In his woodworking shop he makes closets, doors, windows, room dividers, chests of drawers, armoires, kitchen cabinets and any other object made from wood.

He’s asked for a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy raw materials like wood, varnish, hinges and decorations that he needs to finish a contract to make doors.

Henry is grateful to the institution for the financial support provided because this way he won’t fall behind in making the furniture in his shop and will earn income needed to support his family.

loans.use: to buy lumber, varnish and hinges.
